Albert Einstein, a notable physicist, is credited with developing the quantum theory, which changed our perception of light, energy, and matter. He received the Nobel Prize for Chemistry in 1921 for his work on atomic structures. Later, in 1952, he accepted the offer to become the president of Israel but resigned after two years due to health issues.
